titleStmt.title: To RACHEL TALFOURD,Rachel Talfourd (d. 1875), née Rachel Towill Rutt, married Thomas Talfourd 1822. 17 MARCH 1854

body.p: When I heard, on Monday afternoon of the bereavement we both in our far different places so heavily deplore,Thomas Noon Talfourd (1795-1854; Oxford Dictionary of National Biography), writer, judge and politician, and very dear friend to CD, died suddenly on 13 March; CD gives a full account in his letter to John Poole of 17 March; see Pilgrim Letters 7, pp. 294-5. I went instantly to Russell Square. You were not long gone, and I left a note (such as I could write, in the first agitation of so sudden a shock) for Frank.Talfourd’s eldest son, Francis Talfourd (1828-1862).

Mrs. Dickens has called at your door every day since, but I have not obtruded myself upon you. For I well know (or have hoped so) that if I could be of the smallest service or comfort to you or to anybody dear to you, you would instinctively trust my love for my dear departed friend. I have written a brief remembrance of him for the Household Words of next week.CD wrote, 'The chief delight of his life was to give delight to others'; see 'The Late Mr. Justice Talfourd', Household Words 9 (25 March 1854): 117-18. I venture to enclose it to you.Probably one of the special issues, printed for friends on a black-bordered page, of CD’s Household Words notice of Talfourd. It consists of only a few plain words out of my heart, but they may speak to yours.
